edu.biu.scapi.primitives.kdf
Class HKDF

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.primitives.kdf.HKDF
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyDerivationFunction
public final class HKDF
extends java.lang.Object
implements KeyDerivationFunction

Concrete class of key derivation function for HKDF. This is a key derivation function that has a rigorous justification as to its security.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Meital Levy)

deriveKey

public javax.crypto.SecretKey deriveKey(byte[] entropySource,
                                        int inOff,
                                        int inLen,
                                        int outLen,
                                        byte[] iv)
This function derives a new key from the source key material key. The pseudo-code of this function is as follows: COMPUTE PRK = HMAC(XTS, SKM) [key=XTS, data=SKM] Let t be the smallest number so that t * |H|>L where |H| is the HMAC output length K(1) = HMAC(PRK,(CTXinfo,1)) [key=PRK, data=(CTXinfo,1)] FOR i = 2 TO t K(i) = HMAC(PRK,(K(i-1),CTXinfo,i)) [key=PRK, data=(K(i-1),CTXinfo,i)] OUTPUT the first L bits of K(1),…,K(t)

Specified by:
deriveKey in interface KeyDerivationFunction
Parameters:
iv - - CTXInfo
entropySource - the secret key that is the seed for the key generation
inOff - the offset within the entropySource to take the bytes from
inLen - the length of the seed
outLen - the required output key length
Returns:
SecretKey the derivated key.
